hopobject.name: mikrobus
hopobject.http_browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/36.0.1985.143 Safari/537.36
hopobject.shortdesc:
One cape to rule them all!
Four adaptable click interfaces on one cape. Over 90 click boards available to pick and mix, and more clicks coming every month.
hopobject.body:
Main Features

  • Cape provides 4 click board interfaces

  • Over 70 click boards available and counting

  • All essential pins covered

  • Simple design

  • Supports 3.3V and 5V

  • Ideal for breadboards too!

See http://www.mikroe.com/mikrobus/ for more information and to purchase. 

 

 

Info from the Tigal support team:

As for the EEPROM it seems that the manufacturer programmed half of the boards.
We just found out when the sale started.

The dtbo files can be downloaded from our wiki pages.
http://elinux.org/Tigal:BeagleBone_mikrobuscape

Basically only the following lines have to be executed and the uENV.txt modified via c&p:
$ wget http://download.tigal.com/tigal/BBBmikroBUScape/BB_board_dtbo.tar
$ mkdir bbclickdtbo
$ tar -C /home/root/bbclickdtbo/ -xvf BB_board_dtbo.tar
$ cd bbclickdtbo/
$ cp BB-MIKROBUS-01-00A1.dts /lib/firmware/
$ cp BB-MIKROBUS-01-00A1.dtbo /lib/firmware/
$ reboot
